headline.main: REPORTER'S NOTEBOOK: CASTRO OFFERS TO GIVE HIS ALL

byline.original: By ALAN RIDING, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Over the last two decades, Fidel Castro has conceived myriad ways of keeping alive Cuba's revolutionaty spirit. Last year, he caught Cubans by surprise with his campaign against obesity. Now he has asked them to donate their - presumably slimmed down - bodies for medical use after death. ''Let's see if the millions of citizens of this country agree,'' the Cuban leader told a Communist Youth Congress in April, ''and in this way we'll deprive the worms of some of their food.''
